\documentclass{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{comment}

\title{LaTeX Document with Multi-line Comments}
\author{Test Author}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\section{Introduction}

This document contains multi-line comments using the comment package.

\begin{comment}
This is a multi-line comment that should be completely removed.
It can span multiple lines and contain any kind of text.
Including LaTeX commands like \textbf{bold text} and $math$.
This entire block should disappear.
\end{comment}

The above comment block should be completely removed from the output.

\section{Mixed Content}

Here's some regular content.
\begin{comment}
Another multi-line comment block.
This one also contains:
- Lists
- Mathematical expressions: $\sum_{i=1}^{n} i = \frac{n(n+1)}{2}$
- LaTeX commands: \emph{emphasized text}
\end{comment}

And here's more regular content after the comment.

\subsection{Nested Environments}
\begin{comment}
This comment contains nested environments:
\begin{itemize}
    \item First item
    \item Second item with $x^2 + y^2 = z^2$
\end{itemize}
\end{comment}
\section{Conclusion}

End of the document with multi-line comments.

\end{document}
